AVSEC Order  No.  6 /2011 
Subject:- 
Supporting resources for civil  aviation security at the airports  in India 
 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act 1934, delegated 
to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 1797 dated 
July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), for the purpose of  securing the 
aircraft operations and access  control at the  civil  airports in India directs that: 
 
(i) 
to ensure the effective implementation of its national aviation security 
requirements and Annex 17 SARPs, the appropriate authority  and  other  relevant  
authorities  responsible  for  security  oversight  shall  be  provided  with  the  
necessary resources,  human, financial and technical, to be able to effectively 
carry out security oversight obligations on a day-to-day basis, both within normal 
operating conditions and on higher alert during periods of increased threat. 
 
(ii) 
aviation  security  services  at  airports  serving  civil aviation within India 
shall be  provided with supportive resources and facilities, including office space, 
telecommunications equipment,  appropriate  security  equipment  and  training  
facilities.  
 
2. 
Any violation of  this  AVSEC  Order  shall attract penalty under Section 11A of 
the Aircraft Act, 1934. 
 
 
(Gurjot Singh Malhi, IPS)
